snippet: Many in New Hampshire say they made up their minds only very recently about who they would vote for.
abstract: Many voters in the New Hampshire's Republican primary, before handing Mitt Romney a victory, say they made their minds up only at the last minute; say their decisions were based on economic concerns and, in many cases, pragmatism, with the aim of defeating Pres Obama in November.

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and MARJORIE CONNELLY
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jess Bidgood in Salem and Laconia, N.H.; Nicholas Confessore in Portsmouth, N.H.; and Will Storey in Bedford, N.H.

lead_paragraph: Many in New Hampshire say they made up their minds only very recently about who they would vote for.

headline.seo: Weeks of Indecision End for Many New Hampshire Primary Voters
headline.main: Before Handing Romney a Victory, Many Voters Spent Weeks Wavering
headline.print_headline: Before Handing Romney a Victory, Many Voters Spent Weeks Wavering
